snippet: A staring match between strangers, the police said, ended with one woman wounded in a subway car at the Bloomingdale’s stop in Manhattan.
abstract: Knife-wielding woman riding an uptown subway train stabs Manhattan woman multiple times at the 59th Street and Lexington Avenue station, a violent conclusion to what began, the police say, as a staring match between strangers; passengers on the train subdue a female suspect, who is taken to Bellevue Hospital Center for psychiatric identification; unidentified victim is in stable condition.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and RANDY LEONARD

lead_paragraph: A staring match between strangers, the police said, ended with one woman wounded in a subway car at the Bloomingdale’s stop in Manhattan.

headline.main: Woman Is Stabbed on Subway in Apparently Random Attack
headline.print_headline: Woman Is Stabbed on Subway In Apparently Random Attack
